Hi Pete!  My husband suffers with this same issue...underweight type ii diabetes.  If you learn of something that could help, please let me know.  Thanks!

question: I am Type II Diabetic myself and have been under tight-control and with great lab values for over 5 years... and I consider myself well-versed and well-educated about Type II issues, and frequently have folks recently diagnosed coming to me for advice (and I all but always send them to docs, nutritionists, and diabetes educators) but I recently had a question that I have no idea how to answer nor refer...Can alcohol, (I'm guessing alcoholism), or other "insults" to the liver and pancreas actually 'cause' diabetes?...Person who originally posed the question is a Type II Diabetic trying to *gain* weight, and was underwieght when diagnosed 3 years ago, and is still underweight for age/height... and I believe is still drinking... though maybe not...Regardless... do you know if there is any medical literature about excess alcohol consumption causing diabetes, AND, if there is any info about how to treat/advise an underweight type II diabetic?
title: Underweight Diabetic Type II
